description: The first module loaded when using Red Locomotive. Contains The RedLocomotive constructor. Unlike the other modules it is included into the page with a script tag.

methods.name: RedLocomotive
methods.description: The Red Locomotive constructor. This function creates an instance then passes it to a callback. Its also used to load modules.

arguments.name: configOrModuleName
arguments.description: Accepts an object containing configuration for initializing Red Locomotive. Accepts a module name when using 'RedLocomotive()' for defining a module.

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description: Accepts a callback. Accepts a callback passing it a Red Locomotive instance. When defining a module it also passes a second parameter containing the configuration object passed to 'RedLocomotive()' on initialization.

methods.name: require
methods.description: Used to load modules into the current RedLocomotive engine. Modules are stored and loaded from a folder named modules adjacent to the red-locomotive folder. This is suitable for hot loading modules. If you wish to load a module on startup with RedLocomotive you don't need to use this function. You can accomplish this with 'RedLocomotive({ "require": "[moduleNameOne, moduleNameTwo...]" },function(){ //your code });'

arguments.name: moduleName
arguments.description: The name of a module or an array of module names.

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description: A callback to run after the module has been integrated into the engine.

methods.name: loadScript
methods.description: downloads and executes a JavaScript file.

arguments.name: url
arguments.description: A url to a JavaScript file.

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description: A callback to run after the module has been integrated into the engine.

description: Contains the majority of all base functions Red Locomotive is built on. Contains basic timing, positioning, and math related functions. The core module API is not frozen.

methods.name: callCounter
methods.description: Allows funneling of callbacks. Accepts a callback and The number of executions before executing the callback. Returns a clock function that can be passed to a group of functions. Once the returned function has been executed the given number of times, the callback passed to the call counter will be executed.

arguments.name: iterations
arguments.description: The number of times the clock must be executed to trigger the callback.

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description: The callback that fires after the clock has been executed the maximum number of times.

returns.name: clock
returns.description: A clock function that can be passed a number of times as a callback.

methods.name: distance
methods.description: Calculates the distance a pair of coordinates are from 0.

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: The X coordinate.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: The Y coordinate.

returns.name: distance
returns.description: The distance between the X and Y coordinates, and 0.

methods.name: degree
methods.description: Calculates the degree or angle a pair of coordinates are from 0. Moving straight up is 0 degrees.

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: The X coordinate.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: The Y coordinate.

returns.name: degree
returns.description: The degree or angle the X and Y coordinates are from 0.

methods.name: vector
methods.description: Calculates the degree or angle and the distance a pair of coordinates are from 0. Moving straight up is 0 degrees.

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: The X coordinate.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: The Y coordinate.

returns.name: vectorArray
returns.description: An array containing the distance and the degree or angle the X and Y coordinates are from 0.

methods.name: coords
methods.description: Calculates coordinates from degree or angle and a distance are from 0. Moving straight up is 0 degrees.

arguments.name: degree
arguments.description: The degree from 0. Moving straight up is 0 degrees.

arguments.name: distance
arguments.description: The distance from 0.

returns.name: coordinatesArray
returns.description: An array containing an X and Y coordinate from 0.

methods.name: every
methods.description: Executes a callback on a set number of frame draws continuously. Useful for any time based logic.

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description: A callback to be executed on a set number of frame draws.

arguments.name: interval
arguments.description: The number of frames to wait before each callback execution.

methods.name: after
methods.description: Executes a callback on a set number of frame draws a single time. Useful for any time based logic.

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description: A callback to be executed in a set number of frame draws.

arguments.name: interval
arguments.description: The number of frames to wait before executing the callback.

methods.name: event
methods.description: Executes any action callbacks binded to a name with '.when()'.

arguments.name: eventName
arguments.description: The name used to bind to the event.

arguments.name: ...args
arguments.description: Anything other arguments you wish to pass to the binded action callbacks.

methods.name: when
methods.description: Binds a callback to an event name. The callback will be executed when the event is executed with 'event()'.

arguments.name: eventName
arguments.description: The name used to bind to the event.

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description: A callback to be executed with 'event()' using the same event name.

methods.name: random
methods.description: Gives a random number between 0 and a given number.

arguments.name: limit
arguments.description: The maximum value the returned number may have.

methods.name: idGen
methods.description: Returns a unique number.

methods.name: tan
methods.description: Used for calculating tangent from a degree quickly. This function will cache all results.

methods.name: sin
methods.description: Used for calculating sine from a degree quickly. This function will cache all results.

methods.name: cos
methods.description: Used for calculating cosine from a degree quickly. This function will cache all results.

methods.name: atan
methods.description: Used for calculating arc tan from a decimal quickly. This function will cache all results.

methods.name: asin
methods.description: Used for calculating arc sine from a decimal quickly. This function will cache all results.

methods.name: acos
methods.description: Used for calculating arc cosine from a decimal quickly. This function will cache all results.

objects.name: element
objects.description: Contains methods useful for manipulating elements. The Element module API is not frozen.

methods.name: create
methods.description: Creates a element that will be drawn to all viewports every frame.

returns.name: character
returns.description: A character element object that can be directly modified.

arguments.name: elementName
arguments.description: The desired name of the returned element.

arguments.name: spriteSheetName
arguments.description: The sprite sheet object, or name of the sprite sheet the element will use.

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: The X position of the element relative to the world origin.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: The Y position of the element relative to the world origin.

arguments.name: z
arguments.description: The Z height of the element. Controls the order elements are drawn in. Elements with a higher Z height are draw on top of elements with lower Z heights.

arguments.name: spriteColumn
arguments.description: The column of the desired sprite in the sprite sheet assigned in 'spriteSheetName'.

arguments.name: spriteRow
arguments.description: The row of the desired sprite in the sprite sheet assigned in 'spriteSheetName'.

arguments.name: collisionMaskColumn
arguments.description: The column of the desired collision mask sprite in the sprite sheet assigned in 'spriteSheetName'.

arguments.name: collisionMaskRow
arguments.description: The row of the desired collision mask sprite in the sprite sheet assigned in 'spriteSheetName'.

methods.name: get
methods.description: Retrieves an element based on its name. Returns all elements when the first argument is 'all'.

arguments.name: elementName
arguments.description: The name of the element you wish to retrieve. Set 'all' to get all of the elements in the system.

methods.name: remove
methods.description: Removes an element based on its name or by passing the element directly. Removes all elements when the first argument is 'all'.

arguments.name: elementName
arguments.description: The name of the element or the actual element you wish to remove. Setting to 'all' removes all the elements in the system.

methods.name: keepIn
methods.description: Keeps an element in a viewport by scrolling the viewport to the element. A margin can be set to adjust how close the element can get to the edge of the viewport before scrolling.

arguments.name: element
arguments.description: Element object.

arguments.name: viewport
arguments.description: Viewport object.

arguments.name: marginX
arguments.description: The scroll margin for the left and right side of the viewport.

arguments.name: marginY
arguments.description: The scroll margin for the top and bottom of the viewport.

objects.name: character
objects.description: Contains methods useful for manipulating character elements. The Element module API is not frozen.

methods.name: create
methods.description: Creates a character element that will be drawn to all viewports every frame. Characters are elements that have additional properties for movement animation.

returns.name: characterElement
returns.description: A character element object that can be directly modified.

arguments.name: elementName
arguments.description: The desired name of the returned element.

arguments.name: spriteSheetName
arguments.description: The sprite sheet object, or name of the sprite sheet the element will use.

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: The X position of the element relative to the world origin.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: The Y position of the element relative to the world origin.

arguments.name: z
arguments.description: The Z height of the element. Controls the order elements are drawn in. Elements with a higher Z height are draw on top of elements with lower Z heights.

methods.name: onIdle
methods.description: Sets an idle animation sequence. Sequence is applied when the element does not move for one frame.

arguments.name: character
arguments.description: The character element.

arguments.name: startSequence
arguments.description: The first sequence of animation. If a running sequence is defined this sequence runs once, then the running sequence is applied. If the sequence is no supplied then this sequence will continue to run.

arguments.name: runningSequence
arguments.description: The running sequence of animation that is applied after the start sequence has elapsed. Becomes the frames argument when a running sequence is not supplied.

arguments.name: frames
arguments.description: The number of frames between each sequence update.

methods.name: onUp
methods.description: Sets an animation sequence for upwards movement. Sequence is applied when the element does not move for one frame.

arguments.name: character
arguments.description: The character element.

arguments.name: startSequence
arguments.description: The first sequence of animation. If a running sequence is defined this sequence runs once, then the running sequence is applied. If the sequence is no supplied then this sequence will continue to run.

arguments.name: runningSequence
arguments.description: The running sequence of animation that is applied after the start sequence has elapsed. Becomes the frames argument when a running sequence is not supplied.

arguments.name: frames
arguments.description: The number of frames between each sequence update.

methods.name: onDown
methods.description: Sets an animation sequence for downwards movement. Sequence is applied when the element does not move for one frame.

arguments.name: character
arguments.description: The character element.

arguments.name: startSequence
arguments.description: The first sequence of animation. If a running sequence is defined this sequence runs once, then the running sequence is applied. If the sequence is no supplied then this sequence will continue to run.

arguments.name: runningSequence
arguments.description: The running sequence of animation that is applied after the start sequence has elapsed. Becomes the frames argument when a running sequence is not supplied.

arguments.name: frames
arguments.description: The number of frames between each sequence update.

methods.name: onLeft
methods.description: Sets an animation sequence for movement to the left. Sequence is applied when the element does not move for one frame.

arguments.name: character
arguments.description: The character element.

arguments.name: startSequence
arguments.description: The first sequence of animation. If a running sequence is defined this sequence runs once, then the running sequence is applied. If the sequence is no supplied then this sequence will continue to run.

arguments.name: runningSequence
arguments.description: The running sequence of animation that is applied after the start sequence has elapsed. Becomes the frames argument when a running sequence is not supplied.

arguments.name: frames
arguments.description: The number of frames between each sequence update.

methods.name: onRight
methods.description: Sets an animation sequence for movement to the right. Sequence is applied when the element does not move for one frame.

arguments.name: character
arguments.description: The character element.

arguments.name: startSequence
arguments.description: The first sequence of animation. If a running sequence is defined this sequence runs once, then the running sequence is applied. If the sequence is no supplied then this sequence will continue to run.

arguments.name: runningSequence
arguments.description: The running sequence of animation that is applied after the start sequence has elapsed. Becomes the frames argument when a running sequence is not supplied.

arguments.name: frames
arguments.description: The number of frames between each sequence update.

description: Supplies a number of functions for working with image data. Using this module is highly recommended whenever you are working with image data. This module is used extensively by RedLocomotive's internal systems.

methods.name: create
methods.description: Creates a new bitmap object. This function return an empty unmodified canvas if no arguments are set. The object contains a canvas and its context.

arguments.name: width
arguments.description: The width of the bitmap.

arguments.name: height
arguments.description: The height of the bitmap.

arguments.name: image
arguments.description: The source of the bitmap. Can be an image object or a canvas.

arguments.name: sX
arguments.description: The x coordinate to pull from in source image object or canvas.

arguments.name: sY
arguments.description: The y coordinate to pull from in source image object or canvas.

arguments.name: sW
arguments.description: The width of the area to pull from in source image object or canvas.

arguments.name: sH
arguments.description: The height of the area to pull from in source image object or canvas.

arguments.name: dX
arguments.description: The x coordinate to apply the source data to within the new bitmap.

arguments.name: dY
arguments.description: The y coordinate to apply the source data to within the new bitmap.

arguments.name: dW
arguments.description: The width of the area to apply the source data to within the new bitmap.

arguments.name: dH
arguments.description: The height of the area to apply the source data to within the new bitmap.

methods.name: trim
methods.description: Trims off excess transparent pixels around an image. This is useful for removing excessive transparency and reducing the size of a bitmap.

arguments.name: bitmap
arguments.description: A bitmap object created with '.bitmap.create()'.

methods.name: slice
methods.description: Cuts a bitmap up into an array equal sized smaller bitmaps. This is useful for turning sprite sheets into an array of sprites.

arguments.name: bitmap
arguments.description: A bitmap object created with '.bitmap.create()'.

methods.name: dump
methods.description: Dumps an array of pixel data from a bitmap. Unlike canvas's 'getImageData()' function, 'dump()' wraps a pixel's red blue green and alpha data in its own array, then it inserts all of the pixel data into a single array.

arguments.name: bitmap
arguments.description: A bitmap object created with '.bitmap.create()'.

methods.name: isBlank
methods.description: Checks to see if a bitmap is empty. If the bitmap is this empty this function returns true, Otherwise it returns false.

arguments.name: bitmap
arguments.description: A bitmap object created with '.bitmap.create()'.

returns.name: isEmpty
returns.description: If the bitmap is this empty true, Otherwise false.

methods.name: getPointData
methods.description: Gets the red, blue, green, and alpha data from a specific point in a bitmap.

arguments.name: bitmap
arguments.description: A bitmap object created with '.bitmap.create()'.

arguments.name: x
arguments.description: The x coordinate to pull from.

arguments.name: y
arguments.description: The y coordinate to pull from.

returns.name: pixelArray
returns.description: An array containing the red, blue, green, and alpha data.
